thread.title: This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward
thread.title_full: This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward

title: This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward
text:
This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward This week's Apprentice tested candidates' French-speaking skills and it was all very awkward 
â€” Bianca Miller (@Bianca_B_Miller) October 21, 2015 
The episode began with Joseph answering the phone and receiving instructions to head to Dover for this weekâ€™s task. Anyone who wears braces while also wearing pyjamas is not trustworthy to answer a phone correctly. Mark #TheApprentice 
â€” Sam & Mark (@samandmarktv) October 21, 2015 
Joseph and Vana put themselves forward to be project managers. Her accent makes her words so much sassier. #TheApprentice 
â€” Kirstie Saunders (@KirstieLouiseS) October 21, 2015 
And one of their first tests was to find out who could speak French within each group to make trading easier overseas. "I have an A Level""That's very good."ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ #TheApprentice 
â€” Frodo Swaggins (@hellyeh_) October 21, 2015 "Guys I can speak French, listen to this"*clears throat*"baguette" #TheApprentice 
The teams were given a list of items to buy and one of these, of course, was manure, which the teams dug up themselves. 
Some were less country-wise than othersâ€¦ 
â€” The Apprentice (@bbcapprentice) October 21, 2015 Don't know about you but I always shovel manure in my suede stilettos! #TheApprentice #BBCApprentice 
â€” Pauline Martin (@ChampagnePaulie) October 21, 2015 
They were also asked to buy a particular cheese, but unfortunately, the girls bought the wrong kind. Important life lesson: never skimp on cheese. Never. (Never) #TheApprentice 
â€” Rowan Coleman (@rowancoleman) October 21, 2015 THEY BOUGHT THE WRONG CHEESE ALAN #TheApprentice pic.twitter.com/zzRqXnuwsA 
As the episode went on, Vanaâ€™s attitude appeared to grate on Twitter users. Vana's attitude stinks #TheApprentice 
â€” James Flanagan (@JamesFl) October 21, 2015 Why is Katie Hopkins wearing a brunette wig and speaking in an American accent? #TheApprentice 
â€” Brian Butterfield (@MrBButterfield) October 21, 2015 When project manager thinks she's queen #theapprentice https://t.co/jHuqYe9eij 
â€” Â£transfinancalÂ£ (@behlul_official) October 21, 2015 
But others appreciated her honesty. I love that Vanna is so honest and speaks her mind, calls people on their game-playing. I really hope it doesn't hurt her #TheApprentice 
â€” Roisin Hogan (@RoisinEHogan) October 21, 2015 
Ultimately, Jenny was sent packing after Vana dubbed her a â€œdeadweightâ€. However, she didnâ€™t go out without a fight, giving the longest â€˜thank youâ€™ speech in Apprentice history. Maybe. Longest ThankyoufortheoppourtunityLordSugar ever. #TheApprentice Nice speech there Jenny, changed my life #inspirational #TheApprentice Share article
